wJdbjWX2R0pt-hWm26pemg.text: Its awesome lunch, dinner and even snack time! you will enjoy this when you just have the craving.

photos.caption: Photo of TJ Buffet Sushi And Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States. Sushi, shrimp, calamari and frog legs yum!

KmYtoIV2oSZXlTVQjb2BLw.text: We decided to visit the TJ Buffet after it was recommended by a friend. We were politely greeted and seated immediately upon arrival. The buffet contained a large variety of food, including sushi, Chinese food, traditional American food, and desserts. Most items were clearly labeled, but some were not. As we finished each course, the server promptly removed the used dishes from the table. She was pleasant and attentive throughout our visit. The restaurant was clean and well maintained. We visited on Saturday afternoon and were pleasantly surprised to see that each of our meals cost less than $7.00!

APVLGRMGkmNsGEtb6S0UqA.text: As Chinese buffets go this is hands down one of the best in the area it is 10 times better then fortune star in Natrona heights.  but does not even compare to Jimmy Wann's in Fox Chapel who still is the king but you have to expect to spend a lot more money there

rec5pAUqa33Njg1JoeA9kg.text: We love this place! We get it every week! The ladies are so nice especially to our kids. The food is always fresh and it's delish!!

w01fdw7WWe0RYTPfFoxO4w.text: Horrible mistake coming here.  I don't know what was worse, the clientele or the food in the steam trays.

qRJ4qLjfHs9k3tS0Ei0btw.text: Horrible, horrible! !!    How is this sushi? ?   YUK!! The food was nasty, the place was hot & humid.  The floor was sticky, & the people. ....!!!!! My son & I got stomach aches. I will NEVER visit this dump again!

F-GVMALGOIz5fZv-1GanjA.text: This place is a hit or miss. Sometimes it's good and sometimes it's not. It's probably the cheapest Chinese buffet I've been to. You get what you pay for I guess. It's not the best buffet I've been to, but it's also not the worst. I've only been here a few times, I prefer to go to Fortune Star in Natrona Heights instead.

13JfrqqH_hcfC9eQhFxiMg.text: Best value for chinese buffet in the area. The food isn't rave-worthy, but it's not bad. If you're not up to spending China Lobster amounts of money and you need some sweet and sour chicken, this place will do the job just fine.

YQmjtFWKIuLZub_CeBzwrQ.text: Don't waste your time/money, the food is so so, egg roll was made mostly of greasy. Sushi was served around room temperature (warmish raw fish--yuck) and not even slightly chilled, I won't be coming back, too many better options.

vVvcfDD3uy6-83FWCL1mBA.text: Please stay away unless you want to be sick for a week. Round the clock runs for 5 days. Gatorade and Pepto were my only savior. NEVER again!

6Sb8u7oMSZIroaou5OAw3A.text: In the Pittsburgh Mills Mall, cross Macy's next to Panera Bread. Now they have $7 for lunch 11-3:30. As normal Chinese buffet. Seafood and Sushi bar are very good. It's perry new. Very clean. Service is good. Hot tea is too light. Thought it was hot water. That's my only complaint. believe it was a Japanese grill before.

photos.caption: Photo of TJ Buffet Sushi And Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States
Photo of TJ Buffet Sushi And Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States
Photo of TJ Buffet Sushi And Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States

Ehvy5JDaOibGEbl-B0aSnQ.text: Your typical Chinese buffet.   Been there many times and the food has always been fresh.   Service is meh though.   Coke always tastes weird so I get water.   Plenty of shrimp on the dinner buffet.   Never had any issues being sick afterwards.

06NH9smSukyqSOeCc1kACA.text: I went for  Saturday  lunch food is piping hot and looks fresh  and again revisited Sunday dinner some food items are not hot and tastes bad .If you really want to visit this place try lunch buffet.

hJYWYnb0j6eEdrLFEdr84g.text: Food was good for a buffet. Customer service was HORRIBLE. Was charged an extra $3 for all you can eat crab legs. Went to the buffet multiple times over an hour and there were never any crab legs. I asked that the additional $3 be removed from my check and the manager refused. Multiple families complained and management did nothing. Will never go back.

2oOms0za_U3Ghklh94_5kA.text: The food was typical, inexpensive Chinese food. I ate at the buffet and the sushi bar. The food tasted fine. I did not order any hibachi. I was surprised that the price was so cheap. Seating was clean. The waitress tried to take our credit card receipt before we had signed it and left a tip.

E7Oyut7mTHUjq7YdwQdE0A.text: The best thing about this place is that it is very clean. I give it three stars because it is your standard Chinese Buffet. Nothing was wrong although some of the food was on the bland side that is to be expected when the aim is to serve large quantities. There was a sushi buffet includes which was a nice touch. I would come again when I feel like eating a lot of Chinese food.

1JrXRMz3udhvqv4n-rbO1g.text: Can't complain for the price. Food was warm and buffet area was clean. Lunch has a decent selection of your average American chinese buffet

Y-0ijxHe1SYMp96XqbBxyg.text: Quickly seated.  Polite and attentive staff.  Buffet Food was clean and as expected.  Salt and pepper chicken had mostly breading but still tasty.  Servers ptetty and smiled often.  Recommend!

4n7mJAqlcVOKyZwLnJ658Q.text: Food's not going to set the world on fire but for the price, it's a great deal. Full made to order hibachi (chicken, pork, shrimp, sirloin steak). Decent sushi rolls. Above average Chinese food. Plenty of salads and desserts.   If you get rolls and the hibachi, it's an excellent meal. If you just stick to the hibachi and avoid rice and noodles, it's both tasty and healthy meal.

iietm4jh9VlcKCaTcgHv5A.text: Great if you hit them up on a peak hour when food is fresh. Frequent here when littles are free lol. Foods pretty good. Have frog legs and crawl dads, sushi and plenty of the originals. I love their dumplings and general Tso. Great for work and pay by the pound take out whatever can fit in a box lol. I love going here with the family low price and they have free for all on desserts and ice cream. If you expect being immobile the remainder of the day its one of those meals that creep up and have u feeling fuller by the hour lol. If u wanna avoid paying by the sushi roll they are great as well...even have a hibachi station where you can pick ur own raw food and he will cook it for you on the spot....the ambiance is the best it used to be up scale sushi and hibachi joint so it still looks super fancy just without the ridiculous high prices! Great place......if your looking for date type of service try elsewhere.

CsdOOj_kUpDc5t3LhZ69Gw.text: One of the better buffets in Pgh. Good choices well prepared. For the price you won't be disappointed.  How do I know a lot of Asians eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of TJ Buffet Sushi And Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States
Photo of TJ Buffet Sushi And Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States
Photo of TJ Buffet Sushi And Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States

gGAYjS9l4FwrkhKAyDXHCw.text: I'm rating it 5 *s for what it is but it's not a five star restaurant.  For about $12, it's a great deal. For the same $12, I can get one sandwich somewhere else.  Here, I get a complete meal, that's perfectly fine.  Is it the best food I've ever eaten - no, of course not, but for the modest cost, it's a great deal. There's a decent selection of Asian items to choose from, along with a small sushi section + a stir-fry station.  There are cold salad items & cut fruit, as well as desserts, including scooped ice cream.  A bottom-less soft drink costs about $1.00. The restaurant is nice enough looking & the staff is quick to clear dirty plates & re-fill drinks. And there's plenty of parking as this mall has a lot of vacant stores now.  Whatever happens at this mall, I hope TJs is able to survive.

WU4fpYn4TXdvDesxpg2wkg.text: Located in Pittsburgh Mills Galleria. It's essentially your standard Chinese buffet. One nice thing was that they also offered sushi on the buffet which I have not seen at other Chinese buffets that I've been to.   Very clean. Seated and able to proceed to the buffet immediately. Service was very friendly. Reasonable prices.   The food was good but not fantastic. Wonton soup was bland, egg rolls had minimal filling, chicken and broccoli was good so was the salt and pepper chicken. The chocolate pudding had an odd flavor and was a little runny. Fried buns were good.  Husband enjoyed the sushi which was fresh.   Overall, I think this is your standard Chinese buffet with the bonus that they have sushi too. I would return if in the area and very hungry for Chinese. Otherwise, I wouldn't go out of my way because I didn't think it was anything special.

photos.caption: Photo of TJ Buffet Sushi And Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States. Wonton soup, egg rolls, chicken and broccoli, salt and pepper chicken, rice.
Photo of TJ Buffet Sushi And Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States. Fried bun, egg custard, chocolate pudding.

4j2ZkkaepG2XS0dX9vuT8Q.text: The 3 best things I had here were the sushi, the ice cream, and the fortune cookie I had at the end of my meal. The sushi was surprisingly delicious for a buffet, but all the cooked food like General Tso and coconut chicken were overcooked, dry, or cold. The ice cream in the freezer was good though. Curious where they get it from.

AC2gt2tV0nsmelrSTNvvTw.text: It's not that bad, but it's also not that good. I would say it's typical Chinese buffet fare. The buffet area is very small but mirrors make it look bigger. The chicken I had was over cooked but tasted alright.   I'll probably go back at some point, my brother really enjoyed it, but it wouldn't be my first choice.

jgRER57B4UTYJNczr8D5xg.text: Excellent value for your money ! Like any other buffet there are degrees of goodness on it.  The sushi is good and they will make fresh for you if asked. One of the better buffets for the price .

2SSylwwDv9n96j-2SkY-BQ.text: We had dinner here for the first time today. First the food was hot and fresh. Everything we tried was really delicious and not at all greasy. There was an excellent sushi selection. While I personally didn't try the hibachi this time there was a good variety. There were people constantly tending the buffet and the server were very quick and courteous. Then the price of $8.99 for all day Sunday dinner was amazing for the quality and care. We will definitely be returning to this location.

URofoRFgyDUsHix9BYimpg.text: For the money, the food is much better than it probably has a right to be. Certain food items could probably stand to be dropped in favor of things that serve better at a buffet style place. Really enjoy the food and the employees are nice.

7wYQA0lqACuO-bLwB4ALAQ.text: Food was very good but extremely busy and they were running out of a lot of items on the buffet. The restaurant was so busy that people were sitting on top of each other and you had a hard time being able to get to the buffet area. Also we were never given a refill on or drinks and lots of people were complaining about the lack of service.  The food that I ate was very good but the rating was low because of the poor service, not all items being on the buffet 9 items were completely empty and not refilled in the 1 hr I was present.  Also had to hunt down a serve to even get a bill because they had one server for 120 people and she had to take orders, bring drinks, clean tables, and deliver bills. Overall not a place I would probably come to again.

PgzMq22UmzpZzPK8K-hlwA.text: Garbage. It redeemed itself and got 2 stars because the Crab Rangoon was legit.... But who can F#@k that up. Sushi was all fake crab rolls, and looked like a kid with d!@ks for hands rolled them.  Chinese was all frozen food. Save yourself and go somewhere else...

rE5DjLNc9LLyo8o0NsmFiQ.text: Very low quality. Everything was either previously frozen, coated in oil or frozen AND coated in oil. Lots of items were unrecognizable and missing labels. Server did refill drinks and clear plates promptly. Also, the price was lower than other Asian buffets in the area. With that said, I'd rather pay a bit more for better food. We won't be back.

hrbpv9TI3Vui1l5wWdyj1Q.text: Since I am trying to bulk in the winter, I went to the buffet. The food was surprisingly good and the decorations made it feel a bit warmer than a typical buffet. The sushi was tasty and so was everything else in the buffet. I even had dessert. It's probably a staple for anyone in the Tarentum area. I wish they had more locations. The staff was friendly and the facility was packed because I suppose others enjoyed the food too.

cAWCyUkXV_6D38XM6drfPw.text: Saying this place is good means you probably have never been outside of the valley. Overall quality is suspect and the service is poor. See my review for Tokyo sushi on McKnight road if you want to know what a Chinese buffet can be.  And if you mentioned sushi in your review, wtf?!?  A few Cali rolls to choose from (not that I'd trust raw fish here) and none of it was done well.   I know it's cheap for lunch @$6.79 but still not worth it in my eyes.

3RpEwbw8GjfU9VHeD1QOKQ.text: My daughter took me here for the first time. She always told me how great it was, and I have to agree I was very impressed! The buffet it was only $10 and the food choices were very impressive. It was such a wide array of choicesI ended up over eating because I couldn't resist trying the many different options lol! There's really not much service involved but the lady came around to clean up our plates and fill up our water regularly. It's very nice looking on the inside also. The only thing I would stay away from would be the fish. There were lots of sharp bones and one jabbed me pretty good.

RQPyOSWGRchlmwdWd9JpBw.text: I got sick after eating lunch, the flavor wasn't that good. Hing Wong is much better . I won't go back

G4W3vZ495dWrVMMG9qY8Ew.text: Me and my friend have gone to TJ's a zillion billion times I love it there.  Always end up coming home super stuffed ... all their food is great . I love it there

T5g24i7Cds-En9AkpGBS1w.text: We have visited this restaurant twice and both times the food has been fantastic.  We eat at a lot of Chinese buffets, and I know that the quality can change over time, but at the moment this buffet is on the same level as Hokaiddo's in my opinion -- which is to say excellent.  The number of dishes is a little less than other Chinese buffets --- but I also like this aspect  because eating too many different things can upset the stomach.  Fortune Star used to be our favorite but at some point the quality of food seems to have changed and we stopped going there.  The dishes I really enjoyed are the dumplings (very fresh and tasty), the hot and sour soup, the sushi bar (very beautifully designed sushi pieces that are very fresh), and I must say I love their french fries!  The french fries are thick cut potatoes that are crispy and not over-salted.  The only bad thing I can say is that the staff seems to be under a little pressure.  The hostess (and I assume manager or possibly owner) barks out orders like a general and the staff doesn't seem to smile very much but they are very attentive.  The price is only $10 which is really hard for me to believe.  I've eaten at other Chinese buffets that only charge $9 or $10 and the quality is usually poor but NOT here.  The quality is excellent!

X0RXjiFg46k9bNbkqxeAIA.text: They charge you extra for holidays then for normal days which is ridiculous for the same food and the service was slow and we were rushed out of there we didn't even finish eating and we're handed our checks

PDBRkMDm2V4m1xtALreIXg.text: It's a decent buffet, The people acting like it's simply the worst place on the planet imho are overreacting a bit.  While it's nothing special it's nothing terrible either,  and the hibachi is a nice touch.  China lobster is superior in every way just based on buffet quality,  but TJ buffet isn't bad for an occasional change up

LWKUcunsiZz2h37z4NY9IA.text: This place needs to close immediately.  Food and service are pathetic.  We were totally disgusted by this place.

bmE4LeBNPRDB19dZBKzIeQ.text: Best Chinese buffet in the area.  We love that it has the sushi and hibachi.  Also, the inside is really nice which I think sets it apart from other Chinese buffets that sometimes can seem a little sketchy.

atndVZlvcGdvLNSfqD94WQ.text: Well...it is inexpensive and all you can eat. Three of us went to dinner here. They had steam tables with Chinese style food, crayfish and shrimp. There is a hibachi grill. I never saw anyone there to cook although I saw a kid patiently hoping that someone would show up. The shrimp chips were bendable instead of crisp. I asked staff about this and was assured that the chips had been put out today. I eventually ascertained that they had been sitting out since lunch. There were no scoops in the ice cream so people were using their own spoons. This caused there to be mixing of the flavors of ice cream. The more expensive sushi was eaten quickly by other customers and was not replaced while we were there. The Chinese food at the steam tables was bland and greasy.

photos.caption: Photo of TJ Buffet Sushi And Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States
Photo of TJ Buffet Sushi And Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States
Photo of TJ Buffet Sushi And Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States

gwxfj3GhUOwX72i1vsmj5A.text: Food is great but we were harassed for a tip when we had limited cash from our account we

sRfZDmv7CzMCcjkjMBEY2A.text: I rarely write a review but felt compelled to do so because this was by far the worst Chinese buffet I have ever experienced! Everything was luke warm at best, everything was heavily breaded and heavily salted. Even the chicken wings they couldn't get right. The fruit looked like it had been cut days ago. If I could give this place zero stars I would have!

Bub28HbG-mibvweNwEYHXg.text: I was excited to try this place because I love sushi buffets that have a good Chinese option. I was sorry to discover that the sushi has quite bad quality and essentially tastes like fish flavored feral cat penis. I personally don't trust the quality at all. The Chinese buffet is also subpar. The hibachi is the only thing that stops this place from getting zero stars.

nXqxThNm5eUWEPL3Vp46aA.text: Wow. This is one of the Best Chinese buffets I've had in PA there's lots of choices plus they have crayfish,crab,shrimp and the wonton soup was Great. Nice decor and it's really clean inside I like that it's right at the mall entrance with plenty of parking. They have a hibachi grill and the girl cooking was really fast. $10.29 for dinner plus I saw people using coupons is a steal.        It's a must stop if your hungry for Chinese I know I'll be back

photos.caption: Photo of TJ Buffet Sushi And Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States. Really good prices
Photo of TJ Buffet Sushi And Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States. Nice entrance
Photo of TJ Buffet Sushi And Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States

XDkvduzJuCb4-RRMj6MVXA.text: Great selection of food, and it was never cold or looked like it was sitting there all day like some other buffet places. They have crab, shrimp, fish and a lot of great seafood. Server was really on top of filling our waters. The only thing that could use some improvement is their sushi. They had salmon, tuna, California roll maki and some sashimi but their selection was lacking. I would come back - price was also cheap ~$10/person

xhLqa4vZIPFuzGAnMq4QGQ.text: Always good food and good atmosphere. TJ buffet sushi and grill was always a favorite to my father in law and even as we go after he has past on the employees still ask for him and miss him and they give us great service.

M3_m422iqgZJQDWGZK3Vtg.text: The staff here does a nice job filling drinks and keeping the restaurant tidy. Prices are reasonable. Coconut shrimp was amazing. Although the squid was gummy, I give TJ Buffet a solid five stars.

IPUwEkGKNFxrGE6nTpUNAA.text: Came here 2 times both times family got sick. If you have an iron stomach this place is for you. Yuck

HSz1fp3i6VsPHOH1qRyGyw.text: Went for lunch, food was acceptable for a service ur self Chinese buffet! I've had better and worse, this place right in the middle.

vChnCvkpfGHz1Yg2UZdc3g.text: I really enjoyed my lunch at this place. It was good prices are good and alot of food to choice from. It's a buffett style. I liked the variety of food they had

v2WWVlkxw0T9Rw5PQc87zQ.text: Gets only a one star, because of the price.  The sushi is mostly crab - which isn't really crab, it's a type of whitefish.  Plus, the guy is always there making it, but if you go for just sushi, they notice and they'll delay putting more out until you leave.  Most of the other stuff is ok, at best.  Far from a good Chinese restaurant.

SW91BuihSHr1V4gjWFHB5w.text: Large selection of food, inexpensive. For the most part their food is pretty good as well. Their coconut chicken is my favorite thing to get. However, the restaurant could be cleaner, found a dead fly in one of our glasses of water, also some of the plates they put out for the buffet had large droplets of water on them; water in a plate stack= bacteria. Some of the food tastes a little strange, in my opinion, but nothing completely out of the ordinary. I noticed the sweet and sour chicken had a weird blueberry taste in either the sauce or the batter for the chicken they used, also the beef they serve is of a real low quality. One thing I will tell you to absolutely not to get is one of their desserts that looks like a rice crispy treat, but instead of rice crispies, it's different types of nuts. It's rock hard and has almost no flavor, you'll nearly chip a tooth attempting to eat it.  TJ Buffet gets a lot of volume and I noticed they put all of the other Chinese food in the food court out of business so they must be doing something right. Either that or the Mills mall is dying as of late; It could honestly be both. If you're hungry and at the Mall or in the Pittsburgh Mills area I'd recommend stopping by. It might be the only buffet-style restaurant in a 30 mile radius and it's definitely worth giving them a try if you've never eaten there before.

OSYj5n2zoKXwe5cZwyOIRg.text: Best Chinese buffet in the area! The food is always high quality and they're always open (even on Holidays.) Would highly recommend.

wxgE_efAeQQhKJEQ9FQY3A.text: I've written about the TJ Buffet in North hills a number of times; this was my first visit to the Pittsburgh Mills location. I won't mince words; it was only because the North Hills location closed. There was nothing "wrong" with my Sunday dinner here. And I gave it 3 stars which Yelp describes as meaning "A-OK."  Yet I feel it might need a bit of explanation. Why not 4 or 5 stars? Let me say this is a quite reasonable place to have dinner. The price is reasonable, it's clean, the servers are competent, the food is good. You will get your money's worth. However I am left short a bit as to reasons why I'd want to go back. Pittsburgh Mills is a LONG drive for people from metro Pittsburgh. WAY out Route 28 well past the Turnpike. And it's in an empty mall, so there's not much any other reason to go there. Shopping? Please. There's like 3 stores operating out of a million or so square feet of shopping space. The selection on the buffet isn't as extensive as TJ Buffet North Hills had, nor other alternatives such as Hokkaido buffet. There were a few types of sushi, "hibachi" to order, a selection of hot, cold and dessert foods, but not much unusual. Hot crayfish, some heavily breaded crab pieces, and some short Chinese style rib pieces were the only "premium" buffet items. Bottom line: Way better than spending $10 on fast food, but I'm sad that TJ North Hills, and its Japanese predecessor, and Misaki are all gone. Pittsburgh has a vacuum waiting to be filled by a better quality Asian/Sushi buffet.

DbOb47ULe-kGHOzQdo0GMg.text: Excellent Chinese buffet. They have good sushi and a Mongolian wok! The restaurant is clean with a great atmosphere and had entrances both inside and outside the Galleria.

ewFS7WYbYglKG46SKSmowA.text: Always fresh. Never got anything of the buffet that wasn't very good. .unlike most chinese buffets where the food items have been sitting under heat lamps for hours. I drive past 10 chinese restaurants to get to this place.

qm5wt10bgx8RitWO8Qpz8g.text: The health department needs to take a look at this place. All the food I got was cold. Definitely not worth it. Off my list of places to eat.

Td_myq3micwiWqcnsi2Ndg.text: This is one of our family favorite places to go for lunch or dinner. Great assortment of foods hot or cold and fabulous desserts
